info.description:
Authentiq Connect OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect API reference.
Learn about [Authentiq ID](https://www.authentiq.com/) or check out the [Authentiq Connect](https://developers.authentiq.com) developer documentation.
info.title: Authentiq Connect

get.description:
Start a session with Authentiq Connect to authenticate a user.

```
GET https://connect.authentiq.io/authorize?client_id=<your-client-id>&response_type=code+id_token&scope=openid+email&redirect_uri=<your-redirect-uri>&state=0123456789
```

This endpoint also supports the POST method.

parameters.description: A client ID obtained from the [Dashboard](https://dashboard.authentiq.com/).
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: The OIDC response type to use for this authentication flow. Valid choices are `code`, `id_token`, `token`, `token id_token`, `code id_token` `code token` and `code token id_token`, but a client can be configured with a more restricted set.
parameters.name: response_type

parameters.description: The space-separated identity claims to request from the end-user. Always include `openid` as a scope for compatibility with OIDC.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The location to redirect to after (un)successful authentication. See OIDC for the parameters passed in the query string (`response_mode=query`) or as fragments (`response_mode=fragment`). Unless the client is in test-mode this must be one of the registered redirect URLs.
parameters.name: redirect_uri

parameters.description: An opaque string that will be passed back to the redirect URL and therefore can be used to communicate client side state and prevent CSRF attacks.
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: Whether to append parameters to the redirect URL in the query string (`query`) or as fragments (`fragment`). This option usually has a sensible default for each of the response types.
parameters.name: response_mode

parameters.description: An nonce provided by the client (and opaque to Authentiq Connect) that will be included in any ID Token generated for this session. Clients should use the nonce to mitigate replay attacks.
parameters.name: nonce

parameters.description: The authentication display mode, which can be one of `page`, `popup` or `modal`. Defaults to `page`.
parameters.name: display

parameters.description: Space-delimited, case sensitive list of ASCII string values that specifies whether the Authorization Server prompts the End-User for reauthentication and consent. The supported values are: `none`, `login`, `consent`. If `consent` the end-user is asked to (re)confirm what claims they share. Use `none` to check for an active session.
parameters.name: prompt

parameters.description: Specifies the allowable elapsed time in seconds since the last time the end-user was actively authenticated.
parameters.name: max_age

parameters.description: Specifies the preferred language to use on the authorization page, as a space-separated list of BCP47 language tags. Ignored at the moment.
parameters.name: ui_locales

302.description: A successful or erroneous authentication response.

303.description: *Sign in with Authentiq* page, popup or modal.

post.description:
Register a new client with this Authentiq Connect provider.

This endpoint is compatible with [OIDC's Client Registration](http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-registration-1_0.html) extension.

post.description:
Exchange en authorization code for an ID Token or Access Token.

This endpoint supports both `client_secret_basic` (default) and `client_secret_basic` authentication methods, as specified by the client's `token_endpoint_auth_method`.

access_token.description: The access token issued by the authorization server.

expires_at.description: The time the access token will expire in seconds since epoch.

expires_in.description: The lifetime in seconds of the access token.

id_token.description: ID Token value associated with the authenticated session.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token issued to the client, if any.

scope.description: The scope of the granted tokens.

code.description: The authorization code previously obtained from the Authentication endpoint.

redirect_uri.description: The redirect URL that was used previously with the Authentication endpoint.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a user's profile in case you are unable to parse an ID Token or you've not already obtained enough details from the ID Token via the Token Endpoint.

get.description:
An OpenID Connect Session Management iframe to facilitate e.g. single sign-on or remote logouts.

The iframe implements the OIDC postMessage-based [change notification protocol](http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-session-1_0.html#ChangeNotification) via which a client can receive notifications about session state changes.

OAuth2Error.description: Error Response defined as in Section 5.2 of OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749].
